resources.string: In this info panel you will find information about building collapses in your area and safety tips. \n\n Please choose action from top left menu.

Basic CPR 

 1. Try to wake the victim up. 

 2. Call for help. 

 3. Open airway by tilting the victims head back. 

 4. Check breathing by listening and watching chest. 

 5. If the victim breaths put him/her in recovery position. 

 6. If the victim doesn't breath give 2 breaths and begin compressions. 

 7. Continue the cycle of 2 breaths and 30 compressions until help arrives.

Safety during earthquake: 
 - Stay calm. 
 - Find cover, for example under a table. 

 Right after an earthquake: 
 - Put out all fires. 
 - Open door for exit. 
 - Stay away from falling objects. 

 After an earthquake: 
 - Stay away from fires and tsunami. 
 - Listen to information from radio and TV. 
 - Make sure your family and neighbors are safe. 
 - Work together on rescue and first aid. 
 - Turn of electricity and gas before evacuation.
